meanings.definition: To make someone feel unsteady or confused.
meanings.sent1: Spinning around quickly can dizzies you.
meanings.sent2: The fast-moving images on the screen dizzies me.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the movie dizzies the audience.
meanings.sent4: The complex math problem dizzies my mind.
meanings.sent5: The dizzying heights of the roller coaster dizzies riders.

meanings.definition: A feeling of unsteadiness or confusion.
meanings.sent1: After the roller coaster ride, I experienced the dizzies.
meanings.sent2: The dizzies from the spinning made it hard to walk straight.
meanings.sent3: The dizzies of trying to solve the puzzle were frustrating.
meanings.sent4: The dizzies of uncertainty clouded his judgment.
meanings.sent5: The dizzies of the spinning room made her grab onto the nearest chair.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel giddy or lightheaded.
meanings.sent1: The strong scent of the flowers dizzies her.
meanings.sent2: The excitement of the surprise party dizzies him.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected compliment dizzies her with happiness.
meanings.sent4: The thrilling news dizzies them with anticipation.
meanings.sent5: The dizzying speed of the car ride dizzies passengers.
